column4: Hello, does anyone know how I can run fsck on my filesystems if recovery mode refuses to cooperate?
explain the problem properly please
There is a "General error mounting filesystems" and the system offers to go into maintenance mode, asking me to press Ctrl-D or enter the root password for maintenance.
This occurs shortly after I boot into recovery, regardless of what I do.
explain the problem
I had some random power loss, which I am assuming is due to a hardware issue (probably the adapter has gone loose)
So I decided to do a filesystem check to see if everything was all right
But I couldn't boot into single-user aka recovery mode
what is the error ?
Well, I could, but I couldn't get any of the options to work because a "General error mounting filesystems" would occur
Regardless of what I did.
you don't run fsck on a mounted file system
General error mounting filesystems
you need to do it from a recovery / live CD
can I not unmount it from recovery mode?
no because you are using that file system to boot recovery mode
Thought so...
But that doesn't explain the "General error mounting filesystems" error message, though does it?
it does if there is damage to the file systems
What does?
if there is file system damage, that explains the general mounting error
